intro: Neurocarpaea arvensis, commonly known as the field neurocarpaea, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Neurocarpaea arvensis is primarily a herbaceous perennial, with a short life cycle and limited geographic distribution.
